I bought this game after I played Portal 2...

[i]Man that was a mistake.[/i]

This is the type of game that only comes around once in a lifetime. If you haven't played Portal [i]you are missing out.[/i] It has a unique story, unique characters, and VERY unique game mechanics. I have literally never played a game like Portal before. This game has very few bugs and ran quite well on my 4 year old computer. If I were to have one problem with the game, it's that it might be a little too short.


[i]But that's what Portal 2 is for![/i]

Half Life 2 nin puzzle versiyonu olarak düşünebileceğimiz bu oyun, elimizde hiç silah olmadan bir aksiyon oyununu nasıl oynayacağımıza örnek teşkil eden bir yapımdır. Oyun, her bir levelde içinde başladığımız ve çıkışa ulaşmamız beklenen, çeşitli düzenekler kurulu test odalarında geçiyor. Bu odalardaki tuzaklara yakalanmadan, elimizdeki portal oluşturan silah yardımı ile oluşturduğumuz geçişler vasıtasıyla çıkışa ulaşmaya çalışıyoruz. Yer yer beynimizi oldukça meşgul eden bilmecelerle donatılmış zorlu odalarla başa çıkabilmek için ter döküyoruz. Puzzle yönü ağır basan bu 3D Platform türünün tek örneği konumunda. Şiddetle tavsiye ederim.

Portal 

Genre: Puzzle (First Person)

Rating: Fun

Story: Simple and but effective. Portal does a great job telling it's limited story through the use of enviromental clues as well as interaction with the ever-present AI, GLADoS. While not deep, it's quite solid backdrop for a puzzle game that in essense just has you moving from room to room. 

Atmosphere: GLADoS make this game. Here "interactions" really develop a sense of character  and make you want to hear what she says next. Additionally, the facility is peppered with extra touches to make it feel believable.

Tutorial: This game eases you into the concept of Portals very seamlessly. Since it's a testing facility, it's natural to have the first few test be basics and then build from there. The main reason this is important in Portal is that the way 3D space it used (by making Portals) isn't natural to the real world and takes some practice to train the brain. 

Graphics: Very nice for a puzzle game. It's basically a tweaked Half-Life 2 engine so of course it's gonna look pretty (even now). The testing rooms feels appropiately sterile and labratory-ish but other areas are equally well designed to convey it's intended feeling. 

Sound: Honestly, the sounds are fine but there aren't too many to worry about in the controlled enviroments. Some key sounds are used to clue the player in on actions happening out of sight. But mostly, GLADos's synthetic voice is a pefect blend of realism and synthetic. 

Length: It was shorter than I expected but not so short that I didnt feel like it was a full game. Although I imagine milelage might vary depending on how quickly the puzzles are solved. 

 Diffficulty: Not too hard. Know what to do is never really a problem but know HOW to do it another thing. Generally, there weren't any parts that were too complicated to figure out.

Replay: The main story doesn't really warrant repeat play but the addition of achievements and a developer commentary mode make replay worth considering. Additionally, there are challenge rooms that extend the play value. 

VERDICT: Worth it! Fun! Do it!

Bom, se em um futuro distante as máquinas dominarão o mundo ninguém sabe, mas em Portal, o personagem do jogador é desafiado por uma Inteligência Artificial chamada "GLaDOS", que meio que indica os passos para completar cada fase no "Aperture Science Computer-Aided Enrichment Center" usando a Portal Gun. O jogo possui uma jogabilidade "diferente" e proporciona uma boa interação com o jogador, além de forçar o jogador a tomar decisões rapidamente para solucionar os problemas com os quais o personagem se depara ao longo do jogo. Uma boa pedida pra quem gosta de desafios ou puzzles e tem um pouco de paciência sobrando! Lembre-se: "The cake is a lie".

Portal is the best puzzle game out there. I cannot fault it. It involves using a portal gun which creates two different coloured portals which help you solve many different puzzles. The puzzles and levels are very interesting, fun and challenging. This game requires quite a bit of thinking, as well as planning and patience. 

I definitely recommend playing this game first before playing the second one. This game is definitely worth it at full price. :)

Portal exemplifies a video game. Portal is creative, with a simple but eerie story centered around the magnificent central antagonist, GLaDOS, and an innovative concept in the form of the Portal Gun. While stages require some thought and careful planning, the game was designed to be easy enough for most anyone to play through so that they could get to see the whole story (which is arguably the strongest element of the game). The graphics are good - remember that Portal is a rather old game at this point, with a 2007 release date, so don't be expecting HD GLaDOS. You will feel like you are Chell, on a mission to make it through the tests and eventually to destroy GLaDOS, and that is exactly what a video game is supposed to do. 10/10
ultimate puzzle game 11/10

Un gioco che ha fatto la storia, decisamente dedicato a tutti quei giocatori che amano i puzzle games. 

La storyline è abbastanza semplice: dovrete scappare dal laboratorio nel quale siete rinchiusi ad effettuare test da anni usando la vostra astuzia e capacità di riflessione.

Dopo aver giocato questo capitolo vi consiglio l'acquisto di Portal 2, il seguito.

Cuando hablamos de Portal estamos hablando de uno de los mejores juegos de todos los tiempos. Un original juego de puzzles experimental que fue incluido en la ''Orange Box'', en un pack junto a ''Team Fortress 2'' y ''Half Life 2: Episodio 1 y 2''. Es un juego creado por Valve, por lo tanto lo único que puedes esperar es calidad, pero como ya he dicho fue un experimento, por lo tanto es muy corto y te deja con ganas de más, pero por suerte tiene una secuela.

Lo primero que notas cuando llevas unos minutos jugando el juego es que no se trata de algo que ya hayas jugado antes, es totalmente distinto, un sistema de puzzles basado en portales en el cual se juega con las leyes de la física. El juego se desarrolla en un complejo de pruebas de una empresa llamada Aperture Science y básicamente es ir pasando pruebas de lógica siendo guiados por una inteligencia artificial la cual es propensa a hacer chistes. Utiliza el motor gráfico ''Source'', no se ve mal, pero se le notan los años al ser un juego de 2007. El juego implementa un sistema de físicas como el de ''Half Life 2'', pero en este juego hay menos objetos que coger, igualmente en algunos puzzles se tiene que utilizar. Portal no tiene ni una cutscene en todo el juego, cosa que a mi personalmente me encanta ya que hace que la historia se desenvuelva más fluidamente y natural. Tampoco tiene tutoriales, simplemente aparecen un par de indicaciones al principio para enseñarte los controles, otro punto a favor, ya que no te atosiga con tutoriales y deja que te busques la vida para resolver los puzzles, sin ninguna pista. El doblaje al español es bueno, aunque hay pocos diálogos los pocos que hay son brillantes, siguiendo el dicho: ''Si vas a romper el silencio, que sea solo para mejorarlo''. La atmosfera es increíble, haciéndote sentir que estás observado en todo momento y que eres el conejillo de indias de alguien. Otro factor a destacar es su gran antagonista, del cual te vas a enamorar desde el primer momento.

Un defecto de Portal es su escasa duración, pudiéndotelo pasar a lo sumo en 2 horas más o menos, cosa por otra parte comprensible, ya que fue un exitoso experimento para ver si el sistema de puzzles funcionaba y gustaba a los jugadores. Si buscas algo para estar jugando semanas este no es tu juego. Otro factor que también puede resultar negativo es que no tiene mucha historia, pero a mi parecer esto no es un problema, ya que la jugabilidad es lo que te dejará enganchado de principio a fin y la poca que tiene es muy interesante. Si te gusta Portal y quieres lo mismo pero con más historia juega su segunda parte.

Finalmente concluiré con que Portal es uno de los juegos más originales de la historia, un juego emblemático con frases míticas y momentos únicos, una experiencia corta pero intensa. Una obra maestra y clásico del gaming de PC.

Best game ever

Portal is the first game in a long time I've had that I've been totally immersed in, despite there not being much content. I picked this up in a steam sale for around £4, and I can safely say it has been worth it. The level design is well thought out and ever increasing in difficulty, (I must admit I had to look up solutions to 1 or 2 levels) and the "storyline" fits well with the game. There is also a lot of lore and speculation surrounding this game (i.e. who is Chell and the Ratburn crap) which makes for an ever more immersive game experience. And as for GLaDOS... Well... Witty, funny, clever and psychotic are just a few adjectives that describe her. The later levels give off a feeling of... Eeriness... Like you're being watched... Well you are of course but it still has a feeling of tension as you break out of the chamber and advance though the empty pipeworks and offices surrounding Aperture. My only complaint is that there isn't that much content. I completed this game in 1 sitting after 5 hours... I know there is advanced maps and challenge runs etc. but still not a lot of gameplay time. Having said that this is still a game I would recommend to anyone who likes other Valve games (and who enjoys Valve's sense of humour and immersive gameplay). I would give this game 7/10 because although it's a great game with 8/10 visuals (even for my cardboard PC) the content lacks which is why I would recommend also getting Portal 2 which has more content.

Either way I really recomend it to anyone and if you don't have it you should really think about getting it.

Portal, the age old story of a human lab rat, ( Dressed in a lovely prison orange jumpsuit ), that has to run around a maze of Death-defying puzzle traps, in order to appease her AI scientest master. You play as Chell, Or, Rita Consuelo Conchita Maria Hija Del Sol. Anyway, Rita Consuelo Conchita Maria Hija Del Sol, - or Chell for short, - is given a portal gun ( red portal hole for in and, blue portal hole for out, { Im kidding It really doesn't matter which colored portal hole run through}.), and ordered to solve some Unsolvable physical problems through out the game. So you're AI master is trying to kill you and Blah, blah, blah, so what's the big deal about this game. Well its Basically because GLaDos (the computer Ai whos' trying to kill you) is funny. She has to be because Rita Consuelo Conchita Maria Hija Del Sol, - or Chell for short, - dosn't say a dang gon thing. And thats Protal in a nut shell. You run around with a Multidimensional time and space hole making gun trying to escape from your Test facility prison while a computer AI try's to kill you with science. Blah, Blah, Blah.  Just Purchase the game and play it will ya, its a lot of fun and you won't be Sorry.

Even with it coming out before people started making jokes about GabeN never releasing Half-Life 2 Episode 3 or Half-Life 3 or whatever he would call it, this game still brings home quality.

The graphics are good, I personally think the player model could have been better but I'm not going to complain about something like that when this game came out almost a decade ago and already has a sequal.

Gameplay is simple to learn, but gets harder first slowly then quickly. It can be really fun or a huge pain in the arse, depending on your progress of things.

The mechanics are once again easy to learn, but get hard first slowly then quickly. You really need to think slightly in the 'fourth demension' in order to get things to work right. If you enjoy having to think outside the box, this is a game you'll love.

Although I think Portal 2 is better (which is usually how is goes for sequels...unless your name is 'Duke Nukem'), this game is still good enough to come back to on an occasion. Loads of fun, and it just never seems to get boring. And when it does, that bordem is often short-lived.

Great game. Easy to pick up and gradually becomes more challenging as you progress through the game. The more challenging the game becomes, the more you'll find yourself gazing around the chamber before you act, planning on how to get to the next door.

Portal was released in 2007, it had many noticable flaws and the team who worked on portal had years to improve the game thus creating portal 2. Since I played portal 2 before I got the chance to play this it may have clouded my judgement, I do  however think it would be a great game if you haven't played the second one this is a fairly short game, it can be beat it in less then half an hour, if you've played portal 2 already and you want to play the first one it's not really worth it, but if you haven't played either I do recommened playing this one first.

評価: ★★★★★

　プレイすべし。

　単純に、戦闘主体でない「一人称視点パズル」という新ジャンルを開拓した作品(たぶん)であると同時に、そのストーリーの意外性に腰が抜けるほど驚かされ、ラストでは「生まれて初めてFPSで涙を流した」作品。
　パズルとしての面白さ、ストーリーの意外性、登場人物(？)の魅力、そして音楽と、$15程度の作品としては十分過ぎる程の魅力が詰め込まれている。

　遊んだことがないなら是非遊ぶべきだし、他人にオススメすることに何ら躊躇を抱かない作品である。

　強いて言えば3D酔いする人には少し厳しいかも知れない。
　殆どのFPSは視点が揺れることはあれども、水平状態から逆転するようなことはせいぜいムービーシーンくらいしかないが、このゲームはそれが多発する。

　例えば地面にポータルを作り、さらに天井にポータルを作り、地面のポータルに飛び込むと天井から逆さまに自分が出てくる。
　その時点で視点は逆さまになっていて、しかしポータルから出た瞬間に視点は正位置に戻ろうと回転を始める。

　その状態でパズルを解いたりするシーンこそ多くはないものの、酔い易い人間は先に無料版の"First Slice"を遊んでみた方がいいかもしれない。

A great game to have as part of your collection, this is the beginnings of the portal concept later developed in portal 2. The purpose of this game was simply to test if gamers like this type of game, sense this was very original and a unexplored type of game at the time of its release. Its only slightly buggy, you'll probably only find glitches if you go looking for them.
